items.headline: Trump deals blow to Fannie, Freddie privatization hopes. But there are other options that could lift the stocks.
items.summary_en: The directive of President Donald Trump for government-backed-mortgage giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to buy $200 billion worth of mortgage securities would seemingly spell the end to the idea that the giants would go public again in massive initial public offerings.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Choppy quarter to come but stocks will take off afterwards, says this strategist
items.summary_en: Darius Dale thinks there are at least two more rate cuts to come from the Fed but he’s worried about bonds owing to the government’s unsustainable deficit.

items.headline: ‘He even bragged about his Mercedes-Benz:’ I rejected two egotistical advisers. I managed my life savings and they tripled over 25 years. Did I do OK?

items.headline: Rio Tinto may buy Glencore to form mining leader with copper prices near record
items.summary_en: Rio Tinto may buy Glencore to create the biggest mining company, both companies said on Friday, in a deal that comes as metals prices have soared.
